newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Dragonair's turtle rescue mission.
newsitem.headline: Dragonair's turtle rescue mission.

text.p: A group of endangered Malaysian giant freshwater turtles has been flown to a new home in a wildlife reserve from Hong Kong courtesy of Hong Kong Dragon Airlines (Dragonair), the airline said in a press release.

The 13 giant turtles included eight rescued from a Hong Kong flat by Agriculture and Fisheries Department inspectors. Dragonair agreed to fly the turtles to their new home in Kota Kinabalu, East Malaysia because the climate and environment in Hong Kong is unsuitable. One turtle is thought to be more than 200 years old.

"I am glad that these wild turtles have been rescued and will soon be back in their natural habitat. It is our pleasure to take part in the preservation of wildlife," Dragonair's chief executive officer, Stanley Hui, said in a statement. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
